text: [Music]
green-tea Madeleine's are one of my
favorite things to bake during the
holidays and I'm not sure if it's
because they're green and festive or if
it's because I pretty much love anything
that's matcha now before we get started
I just wanted to do a quick shout out
that this video is part of a huge foodie
collaboration with other youtubers we're
trying to bring awareness to charities
and some of our favorite charities
during this holiday season and encourage
giving now I've selected meals-on-wheels
which is a charity that helps deliver
meals to homebound seniors and it's
probably because I have elderly
grandparents and I want to make sure
that they're well fed and they don't go
hungry so definitely want to share that
charity with you guys and if you want to
check out the other charities and other
holiday themed videos at the end of this
video I'll leave a link in the video
description so definitely check those
out as well with that let's get started
baking for this recipe you'll need 3
eggs at room temperature and if you
forgot to take them out earlier that's
ok just put them in a bowl of warm water
for a few seconds and the warm up next
we'll also need 2/3 cup of organic cane
sugar 1 cup of flour 6 tablespoons of
melted butter 1 teaspoon of baking
powder 1/4 teaspoon of salt we will also
need one-and-a-half tablespoons of
matcha powder and finally a tablespoon
of powdered sugar for dusting first
start by preheating your oven to 350
degrees in a mixing bowl beat together
the eggs and sugar until pale yellow
then measure out the dry ingredients and
sift those together before slowly adding
in the egg mixture then finally little
by little the melted butter next cover
and refrigerate the batter for at least
three hours or overnight it's really
better overnight and so we don't have to
wait I've made a separate batch
yesterday so let's go ahead and use that
start by greasing your Madeleine pan
with some melted butter or you can go
ahead and take some cooking spray and
then a pastry brush and lightly brush
that on then using a tablespoon and a
spatula measure
one tablespoon of the matcha batter and
using the spatula carefully put the
matcha batter into the center of the
Madeline tray once you've filled the
tray let the Madeline's bake for 8 to 10
minutes or until the edges are golden
brown remove them from the oven then let
them cool for a few minutes before
gently removing the ballads and placing
them on a wire rack to let them cool
completely once they're cooled take a
small amount of powdered sugar and
lightly dust them on both sides before
serving so that's how you make my green
tea matcha Madeline's they are super
soft and springy mmm he's definitely the
matcha flavor in there and they're so
good and slightly sweet once they've
cool completely you can go ahead and
store them in an airtight container or
you can just eat them all in the first
day I'm angel thank you guys so much for
watching if you haven't subscribed to my
channel already you can do so up here
and don't forget to check out the list
of charities this holiday season that
you can donate to and the playlist for
the other videos I'll link those in the
video description below thank you guys
so much for watching I hope you guys
have a great holiday and I will see you
guys soon
bye for now
